description: This course provides the basic professional knowledge and skills needed for successful entry into the field of modern language teaching. Through readings, class discussions, and active participation in teaching situations, students become familiar with both the theory and the practice of language teaching and are introduced to the issues faced by the profession at large in the beginning of the 21st century. Required field experience component. Offered in the fall semester of the 2019-20 academic year; beginning in the 2020-21 academic year, offered annually in the spring semester. Also counts toward linguistic studies concentration. Prerequisite: EDUC 330.
name: Teaching of World Languages, K-12
notes: Open to rising Seniors and Juniors only.
